name: Lena   Düpont
speech:
.
Denn richtig gemacht, kann gut gesteuerte legale Migration eine Schlüsselkomponente für unsere Wirtschaft sein, wenn und da sie auf die Bedürfnisse des Arbeitsmarktes und den Fachkräftemangel reagiert.
Dabei sind für uns drei Dinge wesentlich: Der Mitgliedstaat entscheidet über Art und Umfang der Zuwanderung. Der Arbeitsmarkt gibt die Kriterien und den Bedarf vor. Das kann neben den hochqualifizierten Fachkräften und Unternehmern auch andere Kriterien und andere Qualifikationen umfassen. Uns fehlen eben in einigen Bereichen nicht nur Ärzte und Ingenieure, sondern auch Arbeitskräfte in der Landwirtschaft, dem Baugewerbe oder der Gesundheitsversorgung.
Entscheidend dafür: Angebot und Nachfrage müssen besser in Einklang gebracht werden. Der talent pooltalent partnerships
Und Drittens: Legale Migration kann und muss ein integraler Bestandteil in der Zusammenarbeit mit Drittstaaten sein, und zwar sowohl im positiven als auch gegebenenfalls im negativen Sinne. Der talent pool talent partnerships
Wenn wir unseren Wohlstand und unsere Innovationskraft erhalten wollen, dürfen wir im globalen Wettbewerb den Anschluss nicht verlieren, und im Moment ist genau das der Fall. Die Vereinigten Staaten, Kanada und Australien sind uns im Werben um die Klügsten und um die Talentiertesten einen großen Schritt voraus.
Mit diesem Bericht heute machen wir die Europäische Union gemeinsam fitter für die Zukunft. Ich danke der Berichterstatterin und den Schattenberichterstattern für die tolle Arbeit.
summary:
This text argues that well-managed legal migration is essential for the EU's economy, particularly to address labor market needs and skill shortages.

It outlines three key principles:
1.  **Member states** determine the type and extent of immigration.
2.  The **labor market** defines the criteria and demand, encompassing not only highly qualified professionals (like doctors and engineers) but also workers in sectors such as agriculture, construction, and healthcare.
3.  **Legal migration** must be an integral part of cooperation with third countries, involving both positive incentives and, if necessary, negative consequences.

The text emphasizes the importance of better aligning labor supply and demand (through initiatives like talent pools and partnerships). It warns that the EU is currently falling behind global competitors like the United States, Canada, and Australia in attracting talent, which threatens its prosperity and innovation. The report mentioned aims to make the European Union more competitive and future-ready in this global talent race.
translation:
Because, when done right, well-managed legal migration can be a key component for our economy, if and as it responds to the needs of the labor market and the shortage of skilled workers.
Three things are essential for us here: The Member State decides on the type and extent of immigration. The labor market sets the criteria and the demand. This can include, besides highly qualified skilled workers and entrepreneurs, other criteria and other qualifications. Indeed, in some areas, we are not just lacking doctors and engineers, but also workers in agriculture, construction, or healthcare.
Crucial for this: Supply and demand must be better aligned. The talent pool talent partnerships
And thirdly: Legal migration can and must be an integral part of cooperation with third countries, both in a positive and, where appropriate, in a negative sense. The talent pool talent partnerships
If we want to maintain our prosperity and our innovative strength, we must not lose ground in global competition, and right now, that is exactly what is happening. The United States, Canada, and Australia are a big step ahead of us in attracting the brightest and most talented.
With this report today, we are collectively making the European Union fitter for the future. I thank the rapporteur and the shadow rapporteurs for their excellent work.

name: Cyrus   Engerer
speech:
.
Flimkien man-negozjaturi tal-gruppi politiċi kollha, rajna kif flimkien nistgħu noħorġu bl-aktar proposti b'saħħithom biex nindirizzaw mhux biss il-bżonnijiet tal-Unjoni Ewropea llum, iżda l-bżonnijiet tal-Unjoni Ewropea tal-futur. Għalhekk qegħdin, mhux biss nitolbu lill-Kummissjoni Ewropea, iżda qegħdin hawnhekk inressqu aħna stess sett ta' proposti b'viżjoni fit-tul u li jkunu future-proof. Irridu Unjoni Ewropea aktar b'saħħitha. Unjoni Ewropea ambizzjuża. Unjoni Ewropea kuraġġjuża li ma tieqaf qatt tinbidel. Unjoni Ewropea bl-aktar talent possibbli li teċċella fl-oqsma kollha. Unjoni Ewropea li tkompli tikber u mhux biss li tibda tipprepara biex tiċkien.
Qed ngħid dan għaliex illum għandna sfida kbira quddiemna: ħwienet, ristoranti, fabbriki, sptarijiet, skejjel li mhux qegħdin isibu biżżejjed ħaddiema biex joffru s-servizzi kollha tagħhom. F'Malta, pajjiżi, smajt il-karba ta' diversi intraprendituri żgħar, jiġi f'moħħi pereżempju żagħżugħ bħal Sean Gravina li investa l-ħin kollu tiegħu biex joħloq dak li dejjem ħolom dwaru, biex isib issa ħajt mingħajr ħaddiema li jista' jħaddem. Smajt ukoll l-inkwiet ta' dawk illi jmexxu l-isptarijiet illi, minkejja li waqt il-pandemija diversi infermiera u tobba barranin, flimkien ma' dawk lokali, żammew l-isptarijiet tagħna għaddejjin, qed jaraw li l-Ewropa ma għadhiex attraenti għalihom u li dawn qed jiċċaqalqu għal bnadi oħra tad-dinja.
Kif qal il-Kummissarju, semmejt Unjoni Ewropea li trid tkompli tikber u mhux tipprepara biex tibda tiċkien għaliex għandna realtà kiefra. Aħna l-iktar kontinent li qiegħed jixjieħ. Soċjetà li qiegħda tikber fl-età u li mhux se tibqa' produttiva kif nafuha llum. Għandna bżonn nattiraw it-talent lejn xtutna u dan għandna nagħmluh b'mod li ma jipperikolax il-ħajja ta' dawk li jkunu ġejjin fl-Ewropa biex jikkontribwixxu għax-xogħol.
Għaliex li ma nindirizzawx is-sitwazzjoni preżenti, ma jfissirx li ma jkollniex ħaddiema minn pajjiżi minn barra l-Unjoni Ewropea, iżda jfisser li dawn il-ħaddiema jiġu b'mod irregolari, probabbilment jispiċċaw jaħdmu b'mod mhux iddikjarat u nkunu qegħdin inħallu l-istandards tal-protezzjoni tal-ħaddiema jitkaxkru mal-art b'esplojtazzjoni inaċċettabbli.
Għalhekk inħares 'il quddiem għall-proposti li ġejjin mill-Kummissjoni Ewropea f'dan ir-rigward ħalli, bħala Unjoni Ewropea, nilħqu l-ambizzjonijiet kollha tagħna.
summary:
The text advocates for a stronger, more ambitious, and growing European Union that actively attracts talent and adapts to change, rather than preparing to shrink. The speaker, presenting their own future-proof proposals, highlights a critical challenge: a widespread labor shortage affecting various sectors like retail, restaurants, factories, hospitals, and schools. This is causing businesses to struggle and Europe to lose foreign talent, particularly in healthcare.

The core reason for this situation is Europe's rapidly aging population, which threatens future productivity. The speaker emphasizes the necessity of safely attracting talent to the EU. Failing to address this proactively, the text warns, will lead to an increase in irregular migration, undeclared work, unacceptable exploitation, and a degradation of worker protection standards. The speaker looks forward to the European Commission's proposals to help the EU achieve its ambitions in this regard.
translation:
Together with the negotiators of all political groups, we have seen how together we can come up with the strongest proposals to address not only the needs of the European Union today, but the needs of the European Union of the future. Therefore, we are not only asking the European Commission, but we are here to present our own set of proposals with a long-term vision and that are future-proof. We want a stronger European Union. An ambitious European Union. A courageous European Union that never stops changing. A European Union with the greatest possible talent that excels in all areas. A European Union that continues to grow and not just starts preparing to shrink.

I am saying this because today we have a great challenge before us: shops, restaurants, factories, hospitals, schools that are not finding enough workers to offer all their services. In Malta, my country, I have heard the cry of various small entrepreneurs; for example, a young man like Sean Gravina comes to mind, who invested all his time to create what he always dreamed of, only to now find a wall without workers he can employ. I have also heard the concerns of those who run hospitals who, despite several foreign nurses and doctors, along with local ones, keeping our hospitals running during the pandemic, are now seeing that Europe is no longer attractive to them and that they are moving to other parts of the world.

As the Commissioner said, I mentioned a European Union that must continue to grow and not prepare to start shrinking because we have a harsh reality. We are the continent that is aging the most. A society that is growing in age and that will not remain as productive as we know it today. We need to attract talent to our shores, and we must do this in a way that does not endanger the lives of those who come to Europe to contribute to work.

Because not addressing the current situation does not mean that we will not have workers from outside the European Union, but it means that these workers will come irregularly, probably end up working undeclared, and we will be allowing worker protection standards to be dragged through the mud with unacceptable exploitation.

Therefore, I look forward to the proposals coming from the European Commission in this regard so that, as the European Union, we can achieve all our ambitions.

name: Fabienne   Keller
speech:
.
En effet, certains secteurs clés de notre économie ont un besoin important de main-d’œuvre. Des domaines essentiels sont d’ailleurs déjà occupés par des travailleurs de pays tiers. Cela a été dit, ils représentent par exemple 5 % des soignants au sein de l’Union.
Nos propositions visent aussi à réduire les disparités entre les États membres en matière, d’une part, d’accès au marché du travail et, d’autre part, d’attractivité pour les talents venus de pays tiers, et ce, en respectant pleinement la compétence des États membres dans ce domaine.
Avec ce texte, nous appelons la Commission (mais vous nous avez dit qu’elle allait le faire, Monsieur le Commissaire) à soumettre des propositions législatives pour mieux harmoniser les conditions d’entrée des travailleurs étrangers dans l’Union européenne. Et je vous propose aussi, Monsieur le Commissaire, d’envisager des programmes de coopération pour la formation des talents que nous recrutons, dans les pays tiers d’où ils viennent. Cette migration légale est un objectif central pour l’attractivité et la compétitivité de l’Union européenne.
summary:
This text highlights the significant labor needs in key EU economic sectors, noting that essential areas already rely on workers from third countries (e.g., 5% of EU healthcare workers).

It proposes reducing disparities among member states regarding market access and attractiveness for foreign talent. The speaker calls on the European Commission to submit legislative proposals to better harmonize entry conditions for foreign workers into the EU. Additionally, it suggests exploring cooperation programs for training these talents in their countries of origin. The overarching goal is that legal migration is crucial for the EU's attractiveness and competitiveness.
translation:
Indeed, some key sectors of our economy have a significant need for labor. Essential fields are already occupied by workers from third countries. This has been stated: they represent, for example, 5% of healthcare workers within the Union.

Our proposals also aim to reduce disparities between Member States concerning, on the one hand, access to the labor market and, on the other hand, attractiveness for talents from third countries, while fully respecting the competence of Member States in this area.

With this text, we call on the Commission (but you told us it would do so, Commissioner) to submit legislative proposals to better harmonize the entry conditions for foreign workers into the European Union. And I also propose, Commissioner, to consider cooperation programs for training the talents we recruit, in the third countries from which they come. This legal migration is a central objective for the attractiveness and competitiveness of the European Union.

name: Alice   Kuhnke
speech:
.
Bristen på lagliga vägar, särskilt för migranter som jobbar i medel- eller låglönesektorer, i kombination med allt fler stängda gränser och restriktiv migrationspolitik tvingar människor till livshotande resor för att nå drömmar om jobb under säkra förhållanden till skälig betalning. Den gröna gruppen välkomnar därför betänkandet som lagts fram av vår kollega Abir Al-Sahlani.
Om betänkandets krav blir verklighet kommer det med tydlighet att förbättra villkoren för migranter som kommer till EU för att arbeta. Vi har dock lagt fram ett ändringsförslag för att få med behovet av ett intersektionellt perspektiv på migrationslagstiftningen. Arbetskraftsinvandrare är inte en homogen grupp, och vi vet att till exempel kvinnor är särskilt utsatta och riskerar att utnyttjas. Den som inte ställer sig bakom Al-Sahlanis betänkande accepterar att människor utnyttjas med livet som insats. Jag hoppas att vi är många som vill se en förändring.
summary:
The text highlights that the lack of legal pathways, increasingly closed borders, and restrictive migration policies force migrants, especially those in middle- and low-wage sectors, into life-threatening journeys in pursuit of safe, fairly paid work.

The Green Group welcomes a report by their colleague Abir Al-Sahlani, believing that its demands, if implemented, would significantly improve conditions for working migrants in the EU. They have, however, proposed an amendment to incorporate an intersectional perspective into migration legislation, stressing that labor migrants are not a homogenous group and that women, for example, are particularly vulnerable to exploitation. The author concludes by stating that not supporting Al-Sahlani's report means accepting the exploitation of people whose lives are at stake, expressing hope for widespread desire for change.
translation:
The lack of legal pathways, especially for migrants working in middle- or low-wage sectors, combined with increasingly closed borders and restrictive migration policies, forces people into life-threatening journeys to achieve their dreams of jobs under safe conditions and fair pay. The Green Group therefore welcomes the report presented by our colleague Abir Al-Sahlani.

If the demands in the report become reality, it will clearly improve the conditions for migrants coming to the EU to work. However, we have submitted an amendment to include the need for an intersectional perspective on migration legislation. Labour migrants are not a homogenous group, and we know that, for example, women are particularly vulnerable and at risk of exploitation. Anyone who does not support Al-Sahlani's report accepts that people are exploited with their lives at stake. I hope that many of us want to see a change.

name: Peter   Kofod
speech:
.
Jeg må sige, jeg er godt nok chokeret. Kommissæren chokerer mig dog mest. Europa er et aldrende kontinent. Men ... hallo! Jeres indvandring giver jo underskud. "Vi er alle migranter", siger kommissæren. Det er noget sludder. Og så slutter kommissæren med at sige: "Migranter skal respektere vores værdier". Ja, selvfølgelig skal de det. Men det er da lidt sent at komme og sige det. Se på Sverige. Se på Belgien. Se på forstæderne i Frankrig.
Det her, det er 20 år for sent. Det er for lidt, og det er for dårligt. Vi vil ikke have jeres indvandring. Vi vil have sikre grænser, og vi vil ikke have flere ufaglærte migranter, som ikke kan bidrage til dette kontinent.
summary: Teksten udtrykker chok og utilfredshed, især rettet mod en europæisk kommissærs udtalelser om indvandring. Taleren mener, at indvandringen i Europa medfører underskud, og afviser kommissærens udsagn om, at "vi er alle migranter", som noget sludder. Mens man er enig i, at migranter skal respektere lokale værdier, kritiseres det, at dette budskab kommer for sent, med henvisning til situationen i Sverige, Belgien og franske forstæder. Teksten konkluderer med en stærk afvisning af den nuværende indvandringspolitik og et krav om sikre grænser samt en afvisning af flere ufaglærte migranter, der ikke kan bidrage til kontinentet.
translation:
I must say, I am quite shocked. The commissioner, however, shocks me the most. Europe is an aging continent. But... hello! Your immigration is causing a deficit. "We are all migrants," says the commissioner. That's nonsense. And then the commissioner concludes by saying: "Migrants must respect our values." Yes, of course they must. But it's a bit late to come and say that. Look at Sweden. Look at Belgium. Look at the suburbs in France.
This, this is 20 years too late. It's too little, and it's too bad. We don't want your immigration. We want secure borders, and we don't want more unskilled migrants who cannot contribute to this continent.

name: Charlie   Weimers
speech:
.
Considering that this report concerns low— and medium—skilled labour migration, that sounds like EU speak for legalising illegal migration. Is the European Parliament’s solution to Turkey and Morocco opening the floodgates? Let them in? To Belarus, weaponising migrants? Let them in?
Now, hundreds of millions of people wish to come to Europe if given the opportunity. Such volumes will only exacerbate unemployment, stagnant wages, not to mention that migrants with incompatible cultures will bring about even less social cohesion. It’s not just last night in Sweden, it’s last night in Amsterdam, it’s last night in Paris.
European leaders seem to have finally smelt the coffee. They realise that we’re losing control. President Michel has called for EU funding of external border barriers. President von der Leyen praised Greece for being Europe’s shield. Even Commissioner Johansson acknowledged that Lithuania’s border barrier is a good idea.
We, conservatives, opposed this report. If you want to take back control, then you should too.
summary:
This speaker criticizes an EU report on low- and medium-skilled labor migration, interpreting it as a move to legalize illegal migration. They express alarm over the prospect of mass migration from countries like Turkey, Morocco, and Belarus, warning that such an influx would exacerbate unemployment, depress wages, and reduce social cohesion due to "incompatible cultures," citing recent incidents across Europe.

However, the speaker notes a perceived shift among European leaders, who now seem to be acknowledging a loss of control. They point to President Michel's call for EU funding for external border barriers, President von der Leyen's praise for Greece as Europe's shield, and Commissioner Johansson's approval of Lithuania's border barrier.

As conservatives, the speaker states their opposition to the report and urges others to oppose it to "take back control."
translation:
Considering that this report concerns low— and medium—skilled labour migration, that sounds like EU speak for legalising illegal migration. Is the European Parliament’s solution to Turkey and Morocco opening the floodgates? Let them in? To Belarus, weaponising migrants? Let them in?
Now, hundreds of millions of people wish to come to Europe if given the opportunity. Such volumes will only exacerbate unemployment, stagnant wages, not to mention that migrants with incompatible cultures will bring about even less social cohesion. It’s not just last night in Sweden, it’s last night in Amsterdam, it’s last night in Paris.
European leaders seem to have finally smelt the coffee. They realise that we’re losing control. President Michel has called for EU funding of external border barriers. President von der Leyen praised Greece for being Europe’s shield. Even Commissioner Johansson acknowledged that Lithuania’s border barrier is a good idea.
We, conservatives, opposed this report. If you want to take back control, then you should too.

name: Pernando   Barrena Arza
speech:
.
However, we believe it’s time to stop seeing labour migration only as a solution to current socioeconomic problems based only on the immediate needs of employers. We must understand this in a broader system which takes into account a number of criteria. Also, in the case of asylum seekers and undocumented workers, they must have access to employment and the same labour rights, ensuring swift action to regularise their status and prevent exploitation at their place of work.
Creating safe and legal pathways is the only way to reduce reliance on unsafe and irregular routes. It’s essential to protect and prioritise vulnerable groups such as children, women and LGBTIQ persons, as it is these groups who suffer the most. We need real, actual and ambitious policies to make the Union strong and a place where human rights matter.
summary: The text advocates for a broader understanding of labour migration, moving beyond solely addressing employers' immediate needs. It stresses the importance of granting asylum seekers and undocumented workers access to employment and labour rights, ensuring swift regularization to prevent exploitation. Creating safe and legal pathways is crucial to reduce reliance on irregular routes and protect vulnerable groups such as children, women, and LGBTIQ persons. Ultimately, it calls for ambitious, human rights-centred policies to strengthen the Union.
translation:
However, we believe it’s time to stop seeing labour migration only as a solution to current socioeconomic problems based only on the immediate needs of employers. We must understand this in a broader system which takes into account a number of criteria. Also, in the case of asylum seekers and undocumented workers, they must have access to employment and the same labour rights, ensuring swift action to regularise their status and prevent exploitation at their place of work.
Creating safe and legal pathways is the only way to reduce reliance on unsafe and irregular routes. It’s essential to protect and prioritise vulnerable groups such as children, women and LGBTIQ persons, as it is these groups who suffer the most. We need real, actual and ambitious policies to make the Union strong and a place where human rights matter.

name: Balázs   Hidvéghi
speech:
– Tisztelt Elnök Úr! Képviselőtársaim! Az Európai Parlament mai jelentése egy újabb példája annak az erkölcstelenségnek, ami már jó ideje folyik itt ebben a Házban. Önök álszent módon az emberi jogok védelmezőinek tüntetik fel magukat, miközben a szegény országok kiszipolyozását erőltetik ezekben a jelentésekben. Azt állítják, hogy a bevándorlás mindenkinek jó, hogy gazdaságilag előnyös, és hogy ezzel kifejezetten segítsük a szegény országokat is. Mindez szemenszedett hazugság. Pont az ellenkezője az igaz. A tömeges bevándorlással, ami a kibocsátó országokból kivándorlást jelent, mindenki veszít. Európa számára jelentős anyagi költségeket jelent és veszélyezteti az európai kultúrát is, amit szemben sokakkal itt ebben a Házban, az európai emberek nem akarnak feladni.
Az elmaradottabb és szegényebb országok és kontinensek számára pedig nem jelent mást, mint kisemmizést. Ha Európa valóban segíteni akar ezeken a régiókon, akkor nem a legképzettebb munkaerőt kell elszívni onnan. Nem ezt kell erőltetni. Sokkal inkább a segítséget kellene odavinni, ahol a baj van. Gazdasági beruházásokkal, infrastrukturális fejlesztésekkel vagy humanitárius segítséggel ott kell segíteni egy jobb élet reményének megteremtésében.
summary:
The speaker strongly criticizes a recent European Parliament report, calling it immoral and hypocritical. They reject the Parliament's claims that migration is economically beneficial and helps poor countries, labeling it a "blatant lie."

Instead, the speaker argues that mass migration results in losses for everyone:
*   **For Europe:** It entails significant financial costs and endangers European culture.
*   **For poorer countries:** It leads to impoverishment by draining their most skilled workforce.

The speaker concludes that if Europe truly wishes to help these regions, it should not encourage migration but rather provide assistance directly where it's needed through economic investments, infrastructure development, and humanitarian aid.
translation:
Mr. President, my fellow Members of Parliament! Today's report by the European Parliament is another example of the immorality that has been going on here in this House for quite some time. You hypocritically portray yourselves as defenders of human rights, while in these reports, you push for the exploitation of poor countries. You claim that immigration is good for everyone, that it is economically beneficial, and that it specifically helps poor countries as well. All of this is an outright lie. The exact opposite is true. With mass immigration, which means emigration from the sending countries, everyone loses. For Europe, it means significant financial costs and also threatens European culture, which, unlike many here in this House, the European people do not want to give up.
And for the more underdeveloped and poorer countries and continents, it means nothing less than ruination. If Europe truly wants to help these regions, then it should not drain away their most skilled workforce. This is not what should be encouraged. Rather, help should be brought to where the problems are. With economic investments, infrastructural developments, or humanitarian aid, help must be provided there to create the hope of a better life.

name: Geoffroy   Didier
speech:
– Monsieur le Président, ceux qui font croire à l’immigration zéro trompent et mentent au peuple, car dans les faits, ça n’existe pas. Mais ceux qui laissent entrer n’importe qui et n’importe comment desservent le peuple, car nous le savons, l’immigration incontrôlée est le meilleur carburant de la xénophobie. Voici une solution et une méthode.
La solution est de laisser chaque pays décider librement du nombre d’immigrés légaux qu’il fait entrer sur son territoire. Cette décision ne doit pas revenir à l’Europe. Elle doit appartenir à chaque pays souverain.
Une méthode: le parlement de chaque pays doit pouvoir voter démocratiquement des plafonds annuels de visas selon des facteurs qu’il déterminera lui-même. Par exemple, zéro visa aux pays sources qui refusent de reprendre sur leur sol leurs clandestins.
Choisir son immigration, c’est pour chaque pays et donc pour l’ensemble de l’Union européenne la seule manière d’agir avec bon sens, fermeté et humanité.
summary:
The speaker argues against both the unrealistic promise of "zero immigration" and the dangers of uncontrolled immigration, which he states fuels xenophobia.

The proposed solution is for each sovereign country, rather than the EU, to freely determine the number of legal immigrants it admits. The suggested method involves national parliaments democratically voting on annual visa caps, based on criteria they define themselves. An example given is denying visas to source countries that refuse to take back their undocumented citizens.

This approach is presented as the only sensible, firm, and humane way for individual countries, and thus for the entire European Union, to manage immigration.
translation:
– Mr. President, those who promote the idea of zero immigration deceive and lie to the people, because in reality, it doesn't exist. But those who let anyone in, in any way, disserve the people, because we know that uncontrolled immigration is the best fuel for xenophobia. Here is a solution and a method.
The solution is to let each country freely decide the number of legal immigrants it allows onto its territory. This decision should not fall to Europe. It must belong to each sovereign country.
A method: the parliament of each country must be able to democratically vote on annual visa caps according to factors it determines itself. For example, zero visas to source countries that refuse to take back their undocumented migrants onto their soil.
Choosing its immigration is, for each country and therefore for the entire European Union, the only way to act with common sense, firmness, and humanity.

name: Sylvie   Guillaume
speech:
– Monsieur le Président, ouvrir des voies légales contrôlées et sécurisées est une des conditions pour mettre en œuvre une politique migratoire mature et digne de notre Union. C’est un signal que je veux adresser à tous les apprentis sorciers qui, dans plusieurs États membres, dont le mien, se lancent dans l’inventaire de l’idée et de la surenchère la plus stupide et inflammatoire.
À plusieurs reprises, notamment avec mon rapport sur la migration et le travail voté en mai, avec l’adoption de la carte bleue, et maintenant avec ce rapport, nous avons montré que parler de migration ne doit pas être synonyme de chaos, de désespoir ou d’instrumentalisation.
Une politique migratoire établissant des voies légales et sécurisées vers l’UE est possible pour combler le manque de main-d’œuvre dans des secteurs clés et pour offrir des voies sûres à ceux et celles qui souhaitent rejoindre notre continent. Je me réjouis d’ailleurs de l’intérêt porté dans ce rapport aux conditions des travailleurs peu ou moyennement qualifiés qui sont souvent oubliés par la législation et les victimes les plus vulnérables face aux réseaux des passeurs.
Cependant, l’approche sectorielle de la migration du travail ne constitue pas une panacée. Nous devons voir plus loin et travailler à l’élaboration d’un code de migration unique définissant des règles générales d’entrée et de séjour dans nos États membres. Ceci pourrait être une belle avancée et une belle ambition pour l’avenir.
summary:
The speaker advocates for establishing legal, controlled, and secure pathways for migration as a fundamental component of a mature and dignified EU migration policy. This is presented as a direct counter to what they describe as stupid and inflammatory anti-immigrant rhetoric from certain member states.

Drawing on previous work, the speaker argues that migration can be managed constructively, addressing labor shortages in key sectors and offering safe routes for those seeking to join the EU, particularly focusing on protecting vulnerable low and medium-skilled workers from smugglers. While acknowledging the value of sectoral approaches, the speaker ultimately proposes a more ambitious future: a comprehensive, unique EU migration code that defines general rules for entry and residency across all member states.
translation:
– Mr. President, opening controlled and secure legal pathways is one of the conditions for implementing a mature migration policy worthy of our Union. This is a signal I want to send to all the sorcerer's apprentices who, in several Member States, including my own, are engaging in the most stupid and inflammatory rhetoric and one-upmanship.
On several occasions, particularly with my report on migration and work voted in May, with the adoption of the Blue Card, and now with this report, we have shown that talking about migration must not be synonymous with chaos, despair, or instrumentalization.
A migration policy establishing legal and secure pathways to the EU is possible to fill labor shortages in key sectors and to offer safe pathways to those who wish to join our continent. I am also pleased by the attention paid in this report to the conditions of low- and medium-skilled workers, who are often overlooked by legislation and are the most vulnerable victims facing smuggler networks.
However, the sectoral approach to labor migration does not constitute a panacea. We must look further and work towards developing a single migration code defining general rules for entry and stay in our Member States. This could be a great step forward and a great ambition for the future.

name: Jérôme   Rivière
speech:
– Monsieur le Président, chers collègues, dans quelques années, quand l’Histoire jugera notre époque, elle ne manquera pas de la classer comme une période sombre pendant laquelle l’Union européenne aura été le creuset de toutes les traîtrises, de tous les renoncements face au danger mortel de l’invasion migratoire. Oui, danger mortel, car il s’agit bien d’une guerre de civilisation que vous laissez s’importer dans nos pays en imposant cette immigration folle, en cherchant à la légaliser par tous les moyens, comme en témoigne ce rapport surréaliste.
Dans cette guerre asymétrique, les migrants sont une arme. J’avais pu le constater avant l’épidémie de COVID, à la frontière entre la Grèce et la Turquie, où je m’étais rendu. J’ai vu les foules de migrants instrumentalisés par Erdoğan, profitant de la faiblesse inhérente de l’Union européenne pour la faire chanter. Aujourd’hui, les mêmes images nous viennent depuis la frontière polonaise. En dépit de cette menace, la majorité ici ne cesse d’attaquer cet État membre et quelques autres pour leurs choix souverains. Et cette Commission ne fait rien pour les assister et protéger notre frontière extérieure, bien au contraire.
Comme dans toutes les guerres, il y a aussi bien des traîtrises. Traîtrise, le refus de Mme von der Leyen de financer un mur à la frontière polonaise. Traîtrise, le financement des ONG mondialistes qui organisent l’immigration légale ou illégale, n’hésitant pas à travailler avec des trafiquants d’êtres humains. Traîtrise, les déclarations de Mme Johansson souhaitant créer de nouveaux parcours légaux pour les migrants. Traîtrise, l’aide inconditionnelle au développement à destination des pays qui nous envoient leurs flux de ressortissants et refusent de reprendre leurs clandestins. Traîtrise enfin, que ce rapport qui crée de nouvelles filières d’immigration.
Mais les peuples des nations d’Europe ne veulent pas mourir. Ils voient bien à travers vos mensonges – non, l’immense majorité des migrants ne sont pas des chercheurs. Alors, optimiste, je sais que leur volonté prévaudra. La détermination des Polonais à résister en est le magnifique exemple. Vos politiques suicidaires sont définitivement condamnées.
summary:
The text presents a strong condemnation of the European Union's migration policy. The speaker characterizes the current era as a "dark period" marked by EU "betrayals" and "renouncements" in the face of a "mortal danger" from "migratory invasion," which is framed as a "war of civilization."

Migrants are described as a "weapon," instrumentalized by actors like Erdoğan at the Greek-Turkish border and now at the Polish border. The speaker criticizes the EU for its inherent weakness, its failure to protect external borders, and its lack of support for member states like Poland. They list various "betrayals," including the refusal to fund a border wall, the financing of "globalist NGOs" that organize legal or illegal immigration (even working with traffickers), statements promoting new legal pathways for migrants, and unconditional development aid to countries that send migrants but refuse to take back their undocumented citizens.

The text concludes with an optimistic assertion that the "peoples of Europe" do not want to "die" and will ultimately resist these "suicidal policies," citing Polish determination as an example.
translation:
Mr. President, dear colleagues, in a few years, when History judges our era, it will not fail to classify it as a dark period during which the European Union will have been the crucible of all betrayals, of all renunciations in the face of the mortal danger of migratory invasion. Yes, mortal danger, because it is indeed a war of civilization that you are allowing to be imported into our countries by imposing this mad immigration, by seeking to legalize it by all means, as this surreal report testifies.

In this asymmetric war, migrants are a weapon. I had been able to observe this before the COVID epidemic, at the border between Greece and Turkey, where I had gone. I saw the crowds of migrants instrumentalized by Erdoğan, taking advantage of the inherent weakness of the European Union to blackmail it. Today, the same images are coming to us from the Polish border. Despite this threat, the majority here continues to attack this Member State and a few others for their sovereign choices. And this Commission does nothing to assist them and protect our external border, quite the opposite.

As in all wars, there are also many betrayals. Betrayal, Mrs. von der Leyen's refusal to finance a wall at the Polish border. Betrayal, the funding of globalist NGOs that organize legal or illegal immigration, not hesitating to work with human traffickers. Betrayal, Mrs. Johansson's statements wishing to create new legal pathways for migrants. Betrayal, unconditional development aid to countries that send us their flows of nationals and refuse to take back their undocumented migrants. Finally, betrayal, this report that creates new immigration channels.

But the peoples of the nations of Europe do not want to die. They see clearly through your lies – no, the vast majority of migrants are not legitimate seekers. So, optimistic, I know that their will shall prevail. The determination of the Poles to resist is a magnificent example of this. Your suicidal policies are definitively condemned.

name: Janina   Ochojska
speech:
– Panie Przewodniczący! Gratuluję sprawozdawczyni tego sprawozdania. Na przestrzeni kolejnych lat ruchy migracyjne będą się nasilać. Wynika to chociażby ze zmian klimatu i ich skutków. W sprawozdaniu jest istotny zapis nawołujący do wzmocnienia legalnych i bezpiecznych dróg migracji dla osób potrzebujących ochronym, takich jak programy przesiedleń, wizy humanitarne i korytarze humanitarne.
Brak perspektyw na zapewnienie bezpieczeństwa swojej rodzinie powoduje wymuszone migracje. Osoby poszukujące schronienia powinny mieć możliwość ubiegania się o ochronę międzynarodową. Nowa tendencja w polityce migracyjnej Unii polega na odgradzaniu się, wypychaniu migrantów, co tylko sprzyja rozwojowi siatki przemytników, którzy obietnicami zwabiają migrantów i narażają ich życie. To dzieje się na granicy polsko-białoruskiej.
Uważam, że należy strzec granic zewnętrznych Unii. Jednak każdy migrant ma prawo poprosić o wszczęcie procedury azylowej, chociaż nie każdy kwalifikuje się do niej. To procedury oparte na prawach podstawowych. O dalszym losie wnioskodawcy powinny rozstrzygać procedury, a nie straż graniczna.
summary:
The speaker predicts an intensification of migration movements in the coming years, primarily due to climate change. They commend the report for advocating for strengthening legal and safe migration routes for those in need of protection, such as resettlement programs, humanitarian visas, and corridors.

The speaker criticizes the EU's current migration policy, which tends to "fence off" and "push back" migrants, arguing that this only fuels smuggling networks and endangers lives, citing the situation on the Polish-Belarusian border as an example. While acknowledging the need to guard the EU's external borders, they emphasize that every migrant has the right to initiate asylum procedures. They stress that these procedures, based on fundamental rights, should determine the applicant's fate, rather than the border guards.
translation:
– Mr. Chairman! I congratulate the rapporteur on this report. In the coming years, migratory movements will intensify. This results, among other things, from climate change and its effects. The report contains an important provision calling for the strengthening of legal and safe migration routes for people in need of protection, such as resettlement programs, humanitarian visas, and humanitarian corridors.
Lack of prospects for ensuring safety for one's family causes forced migration. People seeking refuge should have the opportunity to apply for international protection. A new trend in the Union's migration policy involves walling itself off, pushing migrants back, which only contributes to the growth of smuggler networks, who lure migrants with promises and endanger their lives. This is happening on the Polish-Belarusian border.
I believe that the external borders of the Union must be protected. However, every migrant has the right to request the initiation of asylum procedures, although not everyone qualifies for it. These are procedures based on fundamental rights. The applicant's further fate should be decided by procedures, not by the border guard.

name: Juan Fernando   López Aguilar
speech:
– Señor presidente, vicepresidente Schinas, en una Europa que envejece y con escasez de mano de obra en un número cada vez mayor de empleos, es una magnífica idea que este Parlamento Europeo vaya a aprobar un informe sobre cómo reafirmar, ensanchar, mejorar y actualizar las vías de inmigración legal a la Unión Europea con nueve recomendaciones.
Buena idea la de la reserva de talentos y las asociaciones en materia de talentos para atraer mano de obra cualificada, pero hay más: también necesitan apoyo los autónomos y los emprendedores y sus vías de admisión, incluso los trabajadores escasamente cualificados en determinados nichos de empleo, y, por eso, es imprescindible actualizar la Directiva de permiso único, la Directiva de trabajadores temporeros y la Directiva de residencia de larga duración y establecer un servicio europeo de asesoramiento a los migrantes en situación regular, pero, sobre todo, hay que sancionar y reforzar, por tanto, la Directiva de sanciones a los empresarios o empleadores que exploten a los inmigrantes en situación vulnerable.
Creo que es claro que la migración regular —es el mensaje que manda este informe del Parlamento Europeo— es parte de la solución, no parte del problema: es parte del futuro de la Unión Europea.
summary:
The speaker strongly supports a forthcoming European Parliament report on reaffirming, expanding, and improving legal immigration pathways to the EU, with nine recommendations. This is considered a "magnificent idea" given Europe's aging population and growing labor shortages across various jobs.

Key proposals include attracting skilled labor through talent pools and partnerships, supporting self-employed individuals and entrepreneurs, and even considering low-skilled workers for specific niches. To achieve this, it's essential to update directives like the Single Permit, Seasonal Workers, and Long-Term Residence, and establish a European advisory service for legal migrants. Crucially, the speaker emphasizes the need to strengthen sanctions against employers who exploit vulnerable immigrants.

The overarching message is that regular migration is part of the solution, not the problem, and is vital for the future of the European Union.
translation:
– Mr. President, Vice-President Schinas, in an aging Europe with a labor shortage in a growing number of jobs, it is a magnificent idea that this European Parliament is going to approve a report on how to reaffirm, broaden, improve, and update legal immigration pathways to the European Union with nine recommendations.

The idea of a talent pool and talent partnerships to attract skilled labor is a good one, but there's more: self-employed individuals and entrepreneurs, and their admission pathways, also need support, including even low-skilled workers in certain job niches. For this reason, it is essential to update the Single Permit Directive, the Seasonal Workers Directive, and the Long-Term Residence Directive, and to establish a European advisory service for regular migrants. But, above all, the Employers Sanctions Directive must be enforced and strengthened against employers who exploit vulnerable immigrants.

I believe it is clear that regular migration —this is the message sent by this European Parliament report— is part of the solution, not part of the problem: it is part of the future of the European Union.

name: Nicolaus   Fest
speech:
– Herr Präsident! Lieber Herr Schinas, ich bewundere Sie. Niemand versteht das so wie Sie, in so kurzer Zeit so viele Lügen zu erzählen. Ich werde ein paar von denen richtigstellen.
Sie sagten: Migration sei das Normale. 0,8 % der Weltbevölkerung sind Migranten, 99,2 % sind es nicht. Das Normale ist das Sesshafte.
Sie sagten: Migration ist vorteilhaft für das aufnehmende Land, und berufen sich da auf irgendwelche OECD-Studien. Komischerweise hat gerade der zuständige Kommissar der UN klar gesagt: In der heutigen Zeit ist die Migration für das aufnehmende Land fast immer nachteilhaft.
Sie sagten auch noch: Die meisten Migranten sind legal. Hierzu ein paar Zahlen aus Deutschland: 1,3 % der Asylanträge des letzten Jahres waren berechtigt. Das heißt im Umkehrschluss: 98,7 % der Einreisen waren illegal. Soviel zu Ihrer Behauptung, die meisten Migranten sind legal.
Dieses Konzept hier ist aber nicht nur eine große Lüge oder basiert nicht nur auf Lügen, es ist auch unsozial. Die Jugendarbeitslosigkeit: in Spanien im Augenblick 30,6 %, in Italien 29,8 %, in Schweden 25,1 %, dann kommt Irland mit 24,5 %. Und jetzt wollen Sie noch zusätzlich ungebildete Leute hier reinholen?
Aber auch wenn Sie die holen, vor allem, wenn Sie dann noch die Gebildeten reinholen, bluten die abgebenden Länder aus. Auch dies ist tief unsozial, und Sie sollten endlich aufhören, hier eine Politik zu betreiben, die aus Lügen und großer Unsolidarität besteht.
summary:
The speaker sharply criticizes Herr Schinas, accusing him of making numerous false statements about migration. The speaker refutes several of Schinas's claims:

1.  **Migration as Normal:** Schinas's assertion that migration is normal is contradicted by the fact that only 0.8% of the world's population are migrants, while the vast majority are settled.
2.  **Benefits for Host Countries:** Schinas's claim that migration is advantageous for host countries is countered by a UN Commissioner's statement that it is almost always disadvantageous in the current era.
3.  **Legality of Migrants:** Schinas's statement that most migrants are legal is challenged with German statistics, showing that only 1.3% of asylum applications were justified, implying 98.7% of entries were illegal.

The speaker further argues that the current migration policy is "antisocial" because it exacerbates high youth unemployment in receiving countries (citing Spain, Italy, Sweden, and Ireland) by bringing in uneducated people, and it causes a "brain drain" in sending countries by attracting educated individuals. The speaker concludes by urging an end to this policy, which is described as based on lies and a lack of solidarity.
translation:
– Mr. President! Dear Mr. Schinas, I admire you. No one understands it like you do, to tell so many lies in such a short time. I will correct a few of them.

You said: migration is normal. 0.8% of the world's population are migrants, 99.2% are not. The normal state is being settled.

You said: migration is beneficial for the host country, and you refer to some OECD studies. Funnily enough, the responsible UN Commissioner has just clearly stated: Nowadays, migration is almost always detrimental to the host country.

You also said: Most migrants are legal. Here are a few figures from Germany: 1.3% of last year's asylum applications were justified. This means, conversely: 98.7% of entries were illegal. So much for your claim that most migrants are legal.

This concept here is not only a big lie, or not only based on lies, it is also socially detrimental. Youth unemployment: currently 30.6% in Spain, 29.8% in Italy, 25.1% in Sweden, then comes Ireland with 24.5%. And now you want to bring in even more uneducated people here?

But even if you bring them in, especially if you then also bring in the educated ones, the sending countries bleed out. This too is deeply socially detrimental, and you should finally stop pursuing a policy here that consists of lies and great lack of solidarity.

name: Pietro   Bartolo
speech:
– Signor Presidente, onorevoli colleghi, con questa relazione il Parlamento darà finalmente un segnale importante. Si può adottare un approccio alla migrazione diverso, un approccio lungimirante volto a massimizzare i benefici di questo fenomeno e non, come al solito, volto al contrasto.
Poniamo le basi per una gestione sicura e ordinata della migrazione, creando canali legali per coloro che cercano lavoro nell'Unione europea e togliamo così le persone dalle mani dei trafficanti e sfruttatori.
Non limitiamoci però ai lavoratori altamente qualificati. La pandemia ha mostrato con forza che i lavoratori stranieri danno un contributo essenziale alla nostra economia in settori chiave e che c'è un'altissima domanda di manodopera anche nei settori meno specializzati.
Siamo un continente che invecchia, che ha bisogno di giovani e che può crescere non solo dal punto di vista economico ma anche sociale grazie all'emigrazione lavorativa. Ricordiamoci però di mettere sempre al centro i diritti delle persone, che devono essere tutelate da qualsiasi forma di sfruttamento.
summary:
This text advocates for a new, forward-looking approach to migration that maximizes its benefits rather than focusing solely on control. It proposes establishing safe and orderly legal channels for workers seeking employment in the EU, across all skill levels (not just highly qualified), to counter human trafficking and exploitation.

The speaker emphasizes that foreign workers are essential for the economy, especially given Europe's aging population and high demand for labor (as highlighted by the pandemic), contributing to both economic and social growth. A central tenet of this approach must be the protection of migrants' human rights and their safeguard from all forms of exploitation.
translation:
– Mr. President, distinguished colleagues, with this report, Parliament will finally send an important signal. A different approach to migration can be adopted, a forward-looking approach aimed at maximizing the benefits of this phenomenon and not, as usual, aimed at combating it.
Let's lay the groundwork for safe and orderly migration management, by creating legal channels for those seeking work in the European Union, and thus taking people out of the hands of traffickers and exploiters.
However, let's not limit ourselves to highly skilled workers. The pandemic has strongly shown that foreign workers make an essential contribution to our economy in key sectors, and that there is a very high demand for labor even in less specialized sectors.
We are an aging continent that needs young people and that can grow not only economically but also socially thanks to labor migration. Let's remember, however, to always put people's rights at the center, ensuring they are protected from any form of exploitation.

name: Javier   Moreno Sánchez
speech:
– Señor presidente, querido vicepresidente, Europa necesita migración legal ahora y, aún más, en el futuro.
Necesitamos trabajadores y trabajadoras inmigrantes, no solo por razones demográficas, sino también económicas y geopolíticas. Además, suponen una riqueza cultural para nuestras sociedades.
Para atraer a esos trabajadores, señorías, debemos simplificar y seguir armonizando el marco legal europeo que regula las condiciones de entrada y residencia, acabando con las trabas y la burocracia.
Por eso, siguiendo el ejemplo de la tarjeta azul, pido a la Comisión que presente cuanto antes nuevas propuestas legislativas para los trabajadores de cualificación media y baja, así como para los autónomos y los emprendedores. Además, la Comisión y los Estados miembros deben dar visibilidad y publicidad a las normas existentes, porque no sirve de nada aprobar medidas si nadie las conoce.
Por último, los Estados miembros deben lograr la integración efectiva de los inmigrantes en nuestras sociedades con ambición y los medios presupuestarios adecuados.
summary:
The speaker emphasizes Europe's urgent and future need for legal migration, citing demographic, economic, geopolitical, and cultural benefits. To attract immigrant workers (including medium/low-skilled, self-employed, and entrepreneurs), the text proposes several actions:

1.  **Simplify and harmonize** the European legal framework for entry and residence, eliminating bureaucracy.
2.  The **Commission** should present new legislative proposals, similar to the Blue Card model.
3.  The **Commission and Member States** must ensure existing rules are visible and well-known.
4.  **Member States** must ambitiously and effectively integrate immigrants into society with adequate budgetary resources.
translation:
– Mr. President, dear Vice-President, Europe needs legal migration now and, even more so, in the future.
We need immigrant workers, not only for demographic reasons, but also for economic and geopolitical ones. Additionally, they bring cultural richness to our societies.
To attract these workers, ladies and gentlemen, we must simplify and continue to harmonize the European legal framework that regulates entry and residence conditions, putting an end to obstacles and bureaucracy.
Therefore, following the example of the Blue Card, I ask the Commission to present new legislative proposals as soon as possible for medium and low-skilled workers, as well as for self-employed individuals and entrepreneurs. Furthermore, the Commission and Member States must promote and publicize existing rules, because there is no point in adopting measures if no one is aware of them.
Finally, Member States must achieve the effective integration of immigrants into our societies with ambition and adequate budgetary means.

name: Dominique   Bilde
speech:
.
Il est aujourd’hui évident que le mantra immigrationniste se fonde sur des postulats erronés. D’une part, comment l’immigration pourrait-elle stimuler la croissance et l’emploi, quand on sait que les étrangers extra-européens sont davantage inactifs que les nationaux, en France ? Comment pourrait-elle fournir les talents dont nous manquerions, quand les immigrés qui arrivent en France sont essentiellement peu qualifiés ?
Les « gains économiques » escomptés sont purement théoriques. Ils sont contrebalancés, du reste, par l’impact social et culturel désastreux de l’immigration massive - impact que les Français ressentent déjà douloureusement. Impact également sur leurs salaires, puisque l’immigration exerce fatalement une pression à la baisse. L’Union européenne ne saurait éternellement aller à contre-courant de la volonté des peuples et, sur la question migratoire, elle s’inscrit particulièrement en faux avec elle.
summary:
This text strongly criticizes the prevailing pro-immigration narrative, asserting that its underlying economic assumptions are flawed. It questions how immigration can stimulate growth, employment, or provide skilled talent when non-EU immigrants in France are often inactive or low-skilled.

The author argues that any anticipated economic gains are purely theoretical and are vastly outweighed by the disastrous social and cultural impact of mass immigration, which is already felt by the French population, and its downward pressure on wages. The text concludes by stating that the European Union's migration policy goes against the will of its peoples.
translation:
It is now evident that the pro-immigration mantra is based on erroneous assumptions. Firstly, how could immigration stimulate growth and employment, when we know that non-European foreigners in France are more inactive than nationals? How could it provide the talents we supposedly lack, when the immigrants arriving in France are essentially low-skilled?
The expected "economic gains" are purely theoretical. Furthermore, they are counterbalanced by the disastrous social and cultural impact of mass immigration – an impact that the French already feel painfully. There is also an impact on their wages, since immigration inevitably exerts downward pressure. The European Union cannot forever go against the will of the people, and on the migration issue, it is particularly at odds with it.

name: Joachim Stanisław   Brudziński
speech:
.
Nie może się to jednak odbywać kosztem destabilizacji systemów legalnej migracji oraz ograniczania kompetencji państw członkowskich w tym zakresie. Polska wspierała przyjęcie nowej dyrektywy w sprawie niebieskiej karty, trudno jednak dostrzec potrzeby harmonizacji warunków przyjmowania pracowników nisko i średnio wykwalifikowanych.
Jestem zdania, że obecne warunki uzyskania statusu rezydenta długoterminowego UE, jak również obecne wyłączenia z zakresu dyrektywy są odpowiednie. Podzielam opinię, iż nie ma pilnej potrzeby rewizji dyrektywy w sprawie rezydentów długoterminowych. W opinii Polski partnerstwa w zakresie talentów powinny być przede wszystkim rozwijane z państwami Bałkanów Zachodnich i Partnerstwa Wschodniego. Projektując programy partnerstwa, należy bazować na efektywnych mechanizmach gromadzących informacje o zapotrzebowaniu na zawody, kwalifikacje i umiejętności na poziomie krajowym i regionalnym.
Polska w ostatnich latach stała się krajem atrakcyjnym dla znacznej liczby imigrantów zarobkowych, zaś migracje zarobkowe stanowią istotny czynnik rozwoju społeczno-ekonomicznego Polski, zatem inicjatywy mające na celu usprawnianie przepływu bezpiecznej, legalnej imigracji są dla nas cenne.
summary:
Polska wspiera legalną migrację, ale sprzeciwia się działaniom, które destabilizują systemy migracji lub ograniczają kompetencje państw członkowskich. Poparła nową dyrektywę w sprawie niebieskiej karty, ale nie widzi potrzeby harmonizacji warunków dla pracowników nisko i średnio wykwalifikowanych.

Uważa, że obecne warunki uzyskania statusu rezydenta długoterminowego UE są odpowiednie i nie ma pilnej potrzeby ich rewizji. Polska proponuje rozwijanie partnerstw w zakresie talentów przede wszystkim z państwami Bałkanów Zachodnich i Partnerstwa Wschodniego, opierając się na efektywnych mechanizmach gromadzenia informacji o zapotrzebowaniu na zawody i kwalifikacje.

Polska jest atrakcyjnym krajem dla imigrantów zarobkowych, a migracje zarobkowe są ważnym czynnikiem jej rozwoju społeczno-ekonomicznego, dlatego ceni inicjatywy usprawniające bezpieczną i legalną imigrację.
translation:
This, however, cannot take place at the expense of destabilizing legal migration systems and limiting the competences of member states in this area. Poland supported the adoption of the new Blue Card directive, but it is difficult to see the need to harmonize the conditions for admitting low and medium-skilled workers.
I am of the opinion that the current conditions for obtaining EU long-term resident status, as well as the current exclusions from the directive's scope, are appropriate. I share the view that there is no urgent need to revise the long-term residents directive. In Poland's opinion, talent partnerships should primarily be developed with the Western Balkan countries and the Eastern Partnership countries. When designing partnership programs, it is necessary to base them on effective mechanisms for collecting information on the demand for professions, qualifications, and skills at the national and regional levels.
In recent years, Poland has become an attractive country for a significant number of economic immigrants, and economic migration constitutes an important factor in Poland's socio-economic development; therefore, initiatives aimed at streamlining the flow of safe, legal immigration are valuable to us.

name: Guido   Reil
summary:
It looks like there's no text provided for me to summarize.

Please paste the text you'd like me to read, and I'll be happy to summarize it for you!
